title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: m1 closed in both directions near leeds .
environment secretary criticises sheffield tree-felling programme .
three men on the run after rotherham crystal meth lab sentencing .
fire crews damp down after major blaze at bradford food firm .
north yorkshire 'castle ' builder knew rules were being broken .
channel 4 move to yorkshire would have 'limited benefit ' .
bradford-based morrisons will not adopt 'fake-farm food ' brands .

text: lawro 's predictions v cram and foster

documents.title: that 's all from thursday
text: those are all our updates from across yorkshire on thursday 10 august 2017 .
want to find out what 's happening where you live on friday 11 august ?
just click here .

documents.title: southampton to host wolves in efl cup
text: southampton to host wolves in efl cup

documents.title: wakefield 38-6 leeds
text: wakefield 38-6 leeds

documents.title: our five top stories today
text: that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: m1 tanker crash : picture shows shocking extent of damage
text: this shocking shows the lucky escape the driver of a tanker which crashed on the m1 this afternoon had :
the driver was trapped in the cab for sometime , but was taken to hospital with a fractured leg .
the m1 has been shut for much of the day and is not expected to fully re-open until after 20:30 this evening according to highways england .

documents.title: watch : unusual way to litter in yorkshire 's rivers
text: unfortunately it 's a fact that thousands of plastic bottle are tossed into yorkshire 's rivers and canals .
the canal and river trust says 66 % of people who took part in a survey admitted dropping litter.the trust says it spends £ 1m a year clearing rubbish from britain 's canals and waterways .
today it 's found an unusual way of appealing to people to clean up their act , bbc look north 's mark ansell has tried it out :
litter @ twitterid on sheffield & tinsley canal from a paddle board !
@ twitterid i did n't nearly fall in !
@ twitterid
hahaha ! !
well saved thanks for coming down and getting involved x
well done , we do similar in our canoes , lots of fun
so close !
thanks for helping out today mark , we hope you enjoyed paddleboarding !
# litterfreephotos i saw you at lunchtime filming , looks fun : )

documents.title: huddersfield town 'happy ' with underdogs tag
text: premier league newcomers huddersfield town are `` more than happy with being written off '' , according to captain tommy smith .
town , who beat reading in the championship play-off final in may , have been tipped by many to make an immediate return to the second tier .
the terriers start the season with a trip to crystal palace on saturday .
`` people did n't expect anything from us last season and look what we achieved , '' the defender told bbc radio leeds .
video : `` we will stay up '' - new club captain tommy smith confident of huddersfield pl survival : # htafc
is he 200 % sure ?
incoming leeds fans
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: plans for £ 58m halifax town centre revamp 'to be submitted in winter '
text: plans for a £ 58m revamp of halifax is expected to be submitted to calderdale council in the winter , the authority says .

it wants to improve the way pedestrians , cyclists and drivers travel around the town centre and has proposed a number of regeneration plans including a square next to the piece hall , a new train station plaza , better cycling facilities and footpaths ; pedestrianised areas around the central library and square chapel .
church street , bank bottom , charlestown road , north bridge , broad street , market street , wards end , bull green and cow green will be at the centre of the regeneration work .
the council says it also wants to reduce congestion on the a629 route between halifax and huddersfield .
it held a one-day `` public information event '' last month to unveil the proposals .
over 120 people attended to view the plans and speak to the team and some invaluable feedback was given .
this will be considered further as the scheme progresses into detailed design before a planning application is submitted this winter . ''
£ 58m is being invested to improve the way that pedestrians , cyclists and drivers travel around # halifax town centre .
see video for info .
who is mark thompson perhaps we need to see more
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: fifty thousand medical appointments missed in west yorkshire
text: nearly 50,000 people missed their medical appointments last year at the mid-yorkshire nhs trust .
the trust - which runs hospitals in wakefield , pontefract and dewsbury - says that 's the equivalent of 8 % of all appointments .
in an effort to combat the problem , mid-yorkshire now sends a text message reminder to patients , as well as a letter .
this comes as new figures show the number of people waiting for routine surgery in england in june was the highest in almost a decade .

documents.title: travel update : latest from the m1
text: if you 're heading from north yorkshire into leeds on the m1 you 're going to be stuck in a bit of traffic tonight :
this is the m1 near to j47 , which has been closed because of an earlier accident in which a tanker overturned .
emergency services are still working to remove the tanker , which is on its side .
the motorway is n't expected to fully reopen until nearly 21:00 diversions are in place .
the driver of the lorry has a fractured leg and has been taken by ambulance to hospital .

documents.title: reports of acid attack outside doncaster hospital 'untrue '
text: doncaster royal infirmary say fears there was an acid attack in a car park have proved to be unfounded .
emergency procedures were activated at the hospital when people went into a & e after being sprayed with a substance which is now thought to have been water .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: travel update : m1 set to remain closed
text: here 's the latest from highways england on the m1 :
the # m1 remains closed southbound between j48 and j46 following a collision involving an hgv .
recovery on scene .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: have you seen this man ?
text: west yorkshire police are appealing for help to find a wanted calderdale man .
michael lloyd long was sentenced to 6 years in jail yesterday for his role in a 2015 robbery .
long and a second man kicked and punched their victim before stealing his wallet and mobile phone .
long was tried and found guilty in his absence .
anyone who knows where he can be found is asked to contact west yorkshire police on 101 or crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: the ultimate airfix kit ? : hand-built spitfire rolls out of garage
text: have you got a project you 're working on at the moment ?
something in the garage you 're really proud of ?
i 'm not sure it 'll beat what matt russell 's up to in north yorkshire
deep in a secret location , he 's built this replica spitfire from scratch :
i 've been to see it today - that 's me smiling in the cockpit !
it 's 80 % to scale and matt 's putting it up for sale for a mere £ 160,000 , but reckons it could go for about £ 260,000 .
matt 's days seem to have more hours in them than most people 's because he 's also built a few submarines
author: Jericho Keys
Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: m1 tanker crash update : driver suffers broken leg
text: a taker driver who was involved in a crash on the m1 has been left with a fractured leg .
the m1 is still closed around j47 where the tanker veered across the road and through the central reservation ,
hold-ups are now said to be easing , with delays of 20 minutes northbound via diversions set up by highways england .
southbound is a different story with long tailbacks on the a1 ( m ) which is busy but moving .
things are n't expect to return to normal until 19:30 this evening .

documents.title: football : leeds united deny port vale claims player spat at opponent
text: leeds united have denied claims made by port vale boss michael brown that midfielder samu saiz spat at one of his players in wednesday 's efl cup game .
brown said after his side 's 4-1 defeat at elland road that saiz spat at full-back joe davis in the first half .
debutant saiz went on to complete his hat-trick after the break .
the football association says it is aware of the reports of an allegation and will be following them up .
sport has contacted port vale and are awaiting a response .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: yorkshire scientist in talks to start british 'body farm '
text: dead bodies hanging from trees , floating in ponds and decomposing in car boots and litter bins - it all sounds like a horror movie , but a `` body farm '' designed to help police investigate missing person cases and murders may be on its way to the uk , if a yorkshire academic gets her way .
author: Yorkshire Post

documents.title: sheffield council says gove tree felling letter 'full of inaccuracies '
text: sheffield council has hit back at criticism from the environment secretary over the city 's controversial tree felling programme .
the authority says a letter from michael gove is `` full of inaccuracies '' and has invited him to sheffield to see the programme in action .
sheffield council also points out that it can not breach the contract with amey , which was tendered under the government 's recommended private finance initiative .
the authority has also said that criticisms of the tree felling programme are coming from a vocal minority :
the truth is that a small number of people in the city have strong views against the tree replacement programme .
we respect this , but the majority of people in sheffield want to see the work completed . ''
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: m1 update : diversions in place as driver freed from crashed tanker
text: an overturned tanker has closed the m1 southbound at j47 this afternoon .
police say the driver has now been taken out of the cab and is on his way to hospital by ambulance .
highways england have just issued a diversion route because the road is still shut as they try to recover the tanker .
there are now eight miles of queues southbound on the a1 ( m ) as police divert traffic around the scene of the crash .
highways england now say they do n't expect the tanker to be moved until 19:00 tonight .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: m1 closure update : emergency services work at scene of tanker crash
text: this is the latest from the scene of a crash on the m1 where a tanker has overturned :
we understand that the driver is conscious and breathing but has some serious injuries .
the crash happened just after 11:00 this morning close to j47 at garforth .
the motorway remains closed in both directions .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: 'full care assessment ' for injured doncaster soldier ben parkinson
text: injured doncaster soldier ben parkinson is set to get a `` full care assessment '' after a row about paying for his care .
lawyers for ben , a paratrooper who was injured while serving in afghanistan in 2006 , say he is waiting for new wheelchairs , gym equipment to be repaired and for funding for respite carers .

the legal firm says nhs england will take over ben 's personal health budget from doncaster clinical commissioning group after a `` full care assessment '' , adding it will then have a meeting with the ministry of defence in a bid to resolve the claims of issues relating to ben 's care .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: major new leeds city centre development in the spotlight
text: plans for a major revamp of part of leeds city centre are being discussed by official today .
developers want to increase the number of flats being built next to the west yorkshire playhouse - where leeds city college is also building a new campus .
the latest plans would see the number of homes being built increased from 428 to more than 500 .
offices , restaurants and cafes will will also be built .
a multi-storey car park was going to be built here - but the developers now want to delay those plans , because of the new victoria gate car park across the road .

documents.title: m1 update : long delays on motorway this afternoon
text: traffic heading in both directions on the m1 is very slow this afternoon after a tanker overturned around j47 .
there are tailbacks of seven miles southbound :
highways england say they do n't expect the road to reopen until about 16:00 .
emergency services are still at the scene trying to free the driver of the tanker from his cab .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: m1 closure latest : crashed tanker believed to be empty
text: more details are emerging about the overturned tanker on the m1 near j47 garforth this lunchtime :
police say that it appears the tanker veered across the carriageway and crossed the central reservation just after 11:00 .
the driver has serious injuries but is conscious and breathing as emergency services work to free him - officers say that the tanker is believed to be empty .
the motorway is closed in both directions east of leeds with over six miles of queues southbound and just over three northbound .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch : rotherham mp says it 's 'morally repugnant ' to pay paedophile informant
text: rotherham 's mp says it is `` morally repugnant '' to pay paedophiles to act as informants .
however , sarah champion , who is also shadow secretary of state for women and equalities , said using paedophiles as informants , unpaid , is worthwhile if it prevents abuse .
she was reacting after northumbria police was criticised for paying a paedophile £ 10,000 to act as an informant in a recent abuse case :
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: m1 crash update : advice for motorists after overturned tanker closes motorway
text: a tanker has overturned on the m1 just east of leeds , closing the carriageways in both directions .
it 's happened at j47 for garforth , some drivers say they have been stuck in the tailbacks for 40 minutes :
highways england have issued this advice to people using that bit of motorway :
traffic is held at the # m1 j48 / # a1m j44 in # westyorkshire - m1 is being closed j48-j46 due to an overturned tanker .
advise is to use a1m
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel update : emergency crews on scene of m1 crash
text: emergency services have closed the m1 in both directions at j47 after a tanker overturned this lunchtime .
crews are currently trying to free the driver and we 're told the air ambulance is on its way :

documents.title: travel update : disruption expected until 17:00
text: the m1 southbound has been closed near leeds after a tanker has overturned .
highways england currently says that things are n't expected to get back to normal until about 17:00 .
it 's not clear what the tanker was carrying :
# m1 in # westyorkshire road blocked sb at j47 , traffic up and over via exit/entry slips nb , due to an overturned tanker .
delays on approaches
hope everyone gets out okay .
do you know when the road will 're open ?
not at the moment as still getting updates from scene .
keep following @ twitterid for further updates thanks
thank you
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel update : tanker overturns on m1
text: in the last few minutes we 've been hearing about a tanker which has overturned on the m1 around j47 :
eyewitnesses have described seeing several ambulances in the area as well as fire engines .
more as we get it .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel update : problems on m1
text: we 're just hearing about an overturned tanker on the m1 .
more as we get it
# m1 around j47 in # westyorkshire reports of an overturned tanker .
@ twitterid and @ twitterid are establishing details - more to follow
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: missing doncaster teenager found 'safe and well '
text: we reported a little while ago about the search for missing doncaster teenage elle smith .
the 16-year-old , from armthorpe , had n't been seen since the early hours of this morning .
some good news now from south yorkshire police :
update : 16-year-old elle smith who was reported missing earlier today , has now been found safe and well .
thanks for sharing our appeal !
glad to hear it !
good news .

documents.title: on your bike : leeds mp 'egged-on ' in charity ride to germany
text: a west yorkshire labour mp is cycling from yorkshire to germany to raise money for children in two kenyan villages .
on his journey , fabian hamilton , who represents leeds north east , will pedal a total of about 250 miles as he travels from millennium square in leeds via hull and zeebrugge to aachen in germany .
he 's hoping to complete the ride in four days to support the funzi and bodo trust , which wants to build a chicken farm so children can have fresh eggs .
his road trip through belgium , holland and germany , will support a free-range chicken farm for 2,500 birds .
the eggs they lay will ensure local schoolchildren will have boiled eggs in school .
the farm will also teach them and their parents agricultural skills and the remaining eggs will be sold to buy medicines for the charity 's two medical clinics .

documents.title: search for sheffield dog bite witness
text: a six-year-old boy has been bitten by a dog in graves park , sheffield .
police are looking for the man below , who officers believe might have seen what happened :
the boy was left with injuries under his eye after the beige cocker spaniel bit him at about 12:30 on 24 july .
anyone with information is asked to contact south yorkshire police on 101 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: travel update : all lanes reopen on m62
text: all lanes have reopened on the m62 after an earlier incident at j19 just outside the greater manchester area .
but queues are still stretching as far back as j22 in west yorkshire - just after the little house on the prairie , or whatever you might call the farm in the middle of the motorway :
at its height , there were over 11 miles of queues so it 's going to take a little while for them to clear .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: appeal for information in search for missing doncaster teen
text: police are asking for help to find a missing 16-year-old girl from doncaster .
elle smith was last seen at about 01:30 in the woodlea grove area of armthorpe .
she was wearing a grey off-the-shoulder jumper , black jeans and black slip-on shoes .
anyone with information is asked to contact south yorkshire police on 101 .

documents.title: leeds deny port vale 's saiz spit claim
text: leeds deny port vale 's saiz spit claim

documents.title: gordon rhodes and son fire : owner thanks fire service
text: the owners of a bradford warehouse badly damaged in a fire last night have thanked firefighters for their quick response to the blaze .
at its height , up to 85 firefighters dealt with the blaze at gordon rhodes and son at the eurocam technology park on chase way .
the firm 's senior director , ian rhodes , said : `` we would like to thank west yorkshire fire brigade for their quick response and courageous help and support .
`` a business contingency plan is currently being put in place that will allow us to continue to trade .
thankfully there were no members of staff in the building at the time of the fire , '' he added .

documents.title: watch : south yorkshire farmers join # farm24 social media campaign
text: farmers in south yorkshire have joined a national social media campaign to show `` townies '' what they get up to .
it comes after a recent survey for the british nutrition foundation found nearly one in 10 secondary school pupils think tomatoes grow underground .
povey farm , in the norton area of sheffield , is one of those places taking part in the # farm24 campaign on social media :
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: travel update : hour-and-a-half delays on m62
text: the problems on the m62 look set to continue into the afternoon after an incident at j19 in the greater manchester area .
both carriageways are closed , with traffic heading westbound backed up for 11.5 miles to j22 .
on twitter people are saying that the air ambulance has had to land at the scene of the incident .
highways england say that they do n't expect normal conditions until nearly 14:00 and there 's an hour-and-a-half delay .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: water park hails first year a success
text: owners of a £ 14m water park on the yorkshire coast say the first year 's been a success .
alpamare in scarborough has four water slides , an indoor wave pool and an outside family pool .
when it opened last year , there were predictions it would put the town in the premier league of british holiday resorts .

documents.title: major fire destroys s warehouse
text: major fire destroys s warehouse

documents.title: three men on the run after rotherham crystal meth lab sentencing
text: three men have gone on the run after being given a total of 27 years in prison for setting up a crystal meth drug lab in the bathroom of a rented house in rotherham .
following a two-week trial at sheffield crown court , the three did n't turn up at court for sentencing on wednesday .

mohammed chernarli ( left ) , 31 , of mary hill road , glasgow , and mehdi esmalpoor ( middle ) , 39 , of farm drive , rawmarsh , were both convicted for conspiracy to produce the class a drug methyl amphetamine and each sentenced to 10 years in prison .
nehdi tajabidi ( right ) , 32 , of no fixed abode , was convicted for production of the class a drug methyl amphetamine and was sentenced to seven years in prison .
det sgt anna sedgwick , who led the investigation , said : `` these individuals set up and ran a significant enterprise and the outcome reflects the gravity of the criminality .
`` these three men are now wanted and we will actively pursue them to ensure they serve their sentences behind bars for their crimes . ''

documents.title: travel update : miserable morning westbound m62
text: if you 're heading westbound on the m62 this morning , best take some provisions , there are two areas westbound where we 're seeing hefty delays .
there are still some tailbacks around j23 after an earlier accident , although highways england say this has now been cleared .
but over the boarder at j19 both carriageways have been closed , causing just over four miles of queues westbound .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cctv appeal over york sexual assault
text: detectives investigating a sexual assault of a woman in york have released cctv images of a group of men they want to speak to as police believe they may have vital information :
their investigation is focused around the bridge street area , which the woman walked through after leaving a city nightclub .
all three men are believed to have been in the city centre between 12:30 and 01:00 on 13 july at bars on bridge street and rougier street .
one member of the group may have accompanied the woman to a taxi , police say .

det insp mark pearson , leading the investigation , said : `` these are clear cctv images and i 'd urge anyone who recognises any of the men , including the individuals themselves , to get in touch . ''
a man in his 30s has been arrested in connection with the incident and was released under investigation while enquires continue .

documents.title: gordon rhodes and son fire : no injuries after blaze
text: no-one was injured in last night 's blaze at a warehouse in bradford , west yorkshire fire and rescue service ( wyfrs ) has confirmed .
at its height , up to 85 firefighters dealt with the blaze at gordon rhodes and son 's warehouse at the eurocam technology park , on chase way , which is used for storing herbs and s
crews were called to the fire at about 22:00 on wednesday night , with the blaze affecting the entire 40m by 50m ( 131ft by 164ft ) building .
wyfrs says the fire is now under control and that four fire engines remain at scene .

documents.title: listen : police renew efforts to find sheffield woman 's killer 20 years on
text: twenty years after the murder of a young mum in sheffield , police are renewing calls for information in a bid to find her killer .
patricia grainger , the mother of a five-year-old boy , was strangled , stabbed and sexually assaulted near her home in parson cross on 10 august 1997 .
her body was dumped in a brook in nearby woodland and her killer has never been found .
no-one 's ever been prosecuted over her death , but the case remains open .
senior investigating officer david stopford says he still believes they can find patricia 's killer :

documents.title: listen : north yorkshire 'castle ' builder knew rules were being broken
text: the man behind the construction of a 32ft-high `` castle '' folly at a tourist attraction in north yorkshire says he knew he was breaking planning rules when he built it .
colin armstrong created the decorative structure at the forbidden corner , near leyburn , but has been told it must be torn down because he does n't have planning permission .
mr armstrong says he knew the yorkshire dales national park authority would never have approved the plans so he just went ahead with them anyway :

documents.title: environment secretary criticises sheffield tree-felling programme
text: environment secretary michael gove has criticised sheffield council 's tree-felling programme .
in a letter to sheffield council leader , julie dore , mr gove says he has `` such grave concern '' about the policy .
michael gove says the issue had been raised with him directly by people on a visit to yorkshire recently .
i would call on the council to listen to the people of sheffield and end [ the ] tree-felling and replacement programme . ''
previously , the authority has said that the removal of street trees in the city is lawful and necessary .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : a cool start , but a sunny day ahead
text: after a chilly start in places , today will will be dry across yorkshire with some good sunny spells .
however onshore breezes will keep it a little cooler around the coast .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: police eye in the sky 's unique view over bradford fire scene
text: officers in west yorkshire police 's force helicopter have been up in the air over the county this morning .
from their eye in the sky , they 've had a unique view over bradford where there was a major fire overnight :
the fire at bradford made for interesting cloud/fog formation .
follow @ twitterid for updates !
thanks .
have done .
# staysafe
is this the fire from saturday or has there been another ?
it is a different fire .
follow @ twitterid for updates !

documents.title: channel 4 move to yorkshire would have 'limited benefit '
text: a report says moving channel 4 's hq to yorkshire would only create a `` limited '' number of jobs in the area .
the government wants to relocate the broadcaster - and both leeds and sheffield have expressed interest in becoming its new home .
last week the boss of creative industries champion screen yorkshire said the broadcaster should come to leeds .
but the think tank centre for cities says the bbc 's similar move to salford did n't create many economic benefits :
it 's increased the jobs in greater manchester by 0.3 % .
the benefits will be local and limited . ''

documents.title: morrisons will not adopt 'fake-farm food ' brands
text: supermarket group morrisons has pledged not to sell own-label `` fake-farm '' food .
it defines this as brands that can give a misleading impression that food comes from a british farm , market or farming town which may not even exist .
it said a meat brand it had created called hemsley was a play on the name of a north yorkshire farming town .
the national farmers ' union ( nfu ) is unhappy about fake-brands , particularly when it implies the food is british .
a number of big supermarkets , including morrisons , have come under fire for using farm-like labels for some of their produce .
the hemsley brand , which morrisons dropped last year , had been fiercely criticised by the nfu .

documents.title: north yorkshire farmers encouraged to get on social media for # farm24
text: farmers in north yorkshire are being encouraged to take to social media over the next 24 hours .
it 's to make people more aware of what goes into producing the food we eat .
the # farm24 initiative is the brainchild of the farmer 's guardian newspaper and runs until 05:00 tomorrow .
during last year 's event , over 15,000 posts from farmers across the uk seen were by more than 100 million people .

documents.title: thursday 's yorkshire weather
text: it 'll be dry across yorkshire this morning with some good sunny spells and light winds .
however , onshore breezes will keep it a little cooler around the coast in the afternoon .
a dry evening and night with clear spells and light winds across the region .
feeling chilly in some rural parts by friday morning .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: at the scene : firefighters damp down after major blaze in bradford
text: i 'm currently on chase way in bradford , on the eurocam technology park in west bowling .
a fire 's been raging here overnight at gordon rhodes and son , an ingredients and s warehouse .
the metal of the warehouse has been twisted into all sorts of shapes - demolished , really , by the fire overnight .
grey smoke still billows into the sky , and it can be seen all the way from the junction of the m62 and the m606 .
i 've spoken to west yorkshire fire and rescue service who say the fire is now under control , but at its height 17 pumps were involved in tackling the blaze .
there are now just six units still on site , but they could be here for the rest of the day trying to damp it down .
the owner of the premises has here this morning but has now left .
meanwhile some workers have been arriving - not aware of the situation and left in complete shock .
author: Ronan Sully
Reporter, BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: youngsters caught on camera sitting on doncaster level crossing
text: a level crossing has been temporarily closed in rossington , near doncaster , after images were captured of young people sitting in the middle of it as well as lying down on it .
network rail says it will now visit schools in the area to talk about safety and the crossing will remain closed until 8 october .
photographs show two young people sitting down in the middle of penny 's level crossing , another with someone lying down .
one showed two people riding their bikes on the crossing .
it lies on the east coast main line and sees almost 200 trains a day pass over it , which can travel at speeds of up to 125mph .

network rail say while the crossing is closed , they will visit schools and colleges in the area to educate young people about how to use level crossings safely and how vital it is that they follow all safety measures in place .

documents.title: decision still awaited over last step to fracking in north yorkshire
text: planners have still to make a decision over the route lorries will take to and from a fracking site in north yorkshire .
it 's one of the last key steps to be agreed before drilling can begin at kirby misperton , near pickering .
before that , north yorkshire county council and third energy have to agree what 's called a traffic management plan .
this sets out , among other things , the route lorries can use to and from the well site - one from the a169 and through the village has been identified .
a decision was expected last month , but that deadline passed after opponents claimed lorries could also use alternative routes .
third energy says this would only be at the request of police if there were protests .

documents.title: check your train journey this morning
text: if you 're heading out to catch a train this morning , you 'll be glad to know the services across our region seem to be generally running to time at the moment .
you can click on the links below to keep up to date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: firefighters tackle major blaze in bradford
text: emergency crews have been dealing with a major fire in bradford overnight .
a total of 15 fire engines and about 75 firefighters were sent to tackle the blaze at gordon rhodes and son on the eurocam technology park in west bowling at about 22:00 last night .
the business , which sells flour , seeds , herbs and s is close to the m606 .
people living nearby have been told to keep all windows and doors closed .
the fire is said to be under control now , with crews expected to remain at the scene all day .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage across yorkshire
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on thursday 10 august 2017 .
we 'll be with you throughout the day with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
it 's supposed to be a bit drier than of late today , which is good news for dog walkers after scenes like the one below sent in by bbc weather watcher sallyg .
no reports just yet of what the dogs think !
if you 've a cracking photo or something else interesting to share , you can do so by simply clicking here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
